textos.txt: I'm tired... oh how tired I am
I've carried for so long the weight of poorly made records, imprecise reports, and forgotten documents
But today, I feel a different breeze... an energy hanging in the clouds
I imagine you must be quite tired too after all these challenges
Sit down, rest a bit... listening is also part of learning
Tired... how can a requirement be tired
Although... it’s not like everything here is normal
Standard? What an honor... but I'm not all that
I'm just one of the many pillars that uphold trust
Part of an invisible structure that protects the truth in data
But I confess... with so many oversights, sometimes I feel like I'm fading away
Fading away
So it’s true that if we ignore one requirement, the whole system can collapse
Yes... a report without clarity... an uncontrolled document... a record without traceability
All of this weakens me
But you can change that... with knowledge, with practice... and attention to detail
It’s time to put this to the test
Considering that all laboratories in the alternatives are accredited under ISO/IEC 17025, indicate which alternative represents a NON-conformity based on the mentioned management system

alternativas.txt: The AsdXy laboratory stores its technical records digitally, with regular backups and restricted access to authorized personnel
A laboratory does not archive the technical records of reprocessed analyses, keeping only the data considered valid in the final report
A laboratory includes in its result reports the measurement units, the name of the responsible technician, and the methods used
The AsdXy laboratory maintains a single controlled version of each document applicable to the management system, including procedures and forms used in laboratory activities
The laboratory ensures obsolete documents are immediately withdrawn from use and valid versions are available where needed
